intro: Melampyrum polonicum var. longipilum, commonly known as the long-hair touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with long, soft hairs. The plant produces striking red-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its unique floral structure and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
